knimeNode.name: RowID
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node to replace the RowID and/or to create a column with the values of the current RowID.

intro.p: This node can be used to replace the RowID of the input data with the values of another column (by converting the values to String). The user has additional options to ensure the uniqueness and to handle missing values.
It can also be used to create a new column which contains the RowID as value.
If both options are selected the node appends a new column with the values of the current RowID to the table and replaces the current RowID with the values of the selected column.

p.b: Notice: Highlighting doesn't work across this node.

option.name: Replace RowID with selected column values

fullDescription.option: If selected the node replaces each RowID with the corresponding String value of the selected column.
The column which should replace the current RowID.
If checked the node ensures uniqueness by appending to duplicates a counter (x) where x gets increments for each appearance.
All missing values are replaced with '?' if this check box is ticked. If multiple missing values are found you might want to check the 'Ensure uniqueness' check box as well to handle the duplicates.

option.name: Create new column with the RowID values

fullDescription.option: If selected the node creates a new column with the value of the current RowID.
The name of the new column to append.

ports.dataIn: The data table that should be processed.
ports.dataOut: Data with the row ID values as column and/or a new row IDs
